text: shanghai
is an irresistible snack from cassava
and is a familiar street food to many
student generations in vietnam it's
comprises of cassava cooked in creamy
coconut milk and topped with shredded
coconut and a sweet and salty nut mix
which is full of enticing flavors and
textures let's learn how to make it at
home
peel and soak cassava in cold water
overnight to remove the toxins and then
cut into bite size pieces transfer to a
saucepan filled with enough water to
cover bring to a boil and cook for about
five minutes then dump out the water to
remove the toxins add 400 ml of coconut
juice 100 ml of coconut milk tie a few
penguin leaves into a knot and drop to
the pot to add more fragrance also add
50 gram sugar and a pinch of salt bring
to a boil over medium heat and cook for
about 30 to 35 minutes until the cassava
is cooked through and tender for the
coconut sauce in a small saucepan
combine 100ml of coconut juice 200ml of
coconut milk a pinch of salt and a
tablespoon of tapioca starch stir well
to dissolve and then turn on the stove
continue to stir and cook over medium
heat until the coconut sauce thickens
transfer the cooked cassava into a
steamer you can keep it warm in a
steamer and before serving drizzle the
coconut sauce all over the top garnish
with some shredded young coconut and a
sprinkle of crushed rotis peanuts and
sesame seeds because the cassava is
cooked long enough in the coconut and
sugar mixture it turns great glutinous
and fragrance really tasty such a simple
but amazing snack if the dish brings
back some good memories of you don't
forget to click like and subscribe share
with your friends this video and i will
see you the next time bye
[Music]
you
